intro: Onychium tricuspe, commonly known as the three-lobed onychium, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and sometimes edible roots. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, and it has a short, creeping stem with hairy leaves. Onychium tricuspe is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
